header: How to set a song as an iPhone tone?

panels.header: 1. Create a copy of a song with duration 40 seconds or less.
labels: a. Find the song in the iTunes and select Get Info in its context menu.
b. On the Options tab set the start and the stop time and click OK.
c. In the iTunes menu select sequentially items File, Convert and Create ACC Version.
d. A copy of the song will appear, select Show in Finder in its context menu.

labels: a. Drag the copy to a folder specifically created for ringtones.
b. In the context menu of the copy select item Get Info.
c. Change file extension to "m4r" in the appeared window and close it.
d. Delete the copy form the iTunes Library.

panels.header: 3. Import the ringtone to iPhone using iTunes.
labels: a. In a drop-down menu Music in the iTunes select an item Tones.
b. Drag the ringtone to the iTunes.
c. Click on the button with image of iPhone or iPad to the right of menu Tones.
d. On the appeared screen select item Tones on the left, then select checkmark Sync Tones sounds and click Done.

panels.header: 4. Set the new ringtone on your iPhone.
labels: a. Open settings on the iPhone or the iPad.
b. Sequentially select items Sounds and Ringtone.
c. Then find and select previously created ringtone.
d. Check out a Purchase button in the top right corner and make conclusions.
